title.rendered: Electrician in Vaughan: 4 Benefits of Having Outdoor Outlets

content.rendered:
The summer is here, and that means more people will spend the majority of their family time outdoors, enjoying the sun and climate. While backyards, decks, and other entertainment spaces are wonderful for creating family memories in the summer, they often lack a power source. Hiring an electrician in Vaughan to install some outdoor outlets is an excellent way to improve the functionality of your outdoor area.  

While outdoor outlets are becoming common additions to new builds, some homeowners may not be familiar with the concept. A common misconception of outdoor outlets is that they are unsafe. The assumption makes sense on the surface because people associate the outdoors with dampness. However, all outdoor outlets include a ground fault circuit interrupter. Commonly known as GFCI outlets, the plug automatically cuts the power when it detects an imbalance in the circuit, such as humidity or water. There are several benefits to the installation if you do not already have an outdoor outlet.  

1. Convenience

As all electrical repair services will explain, the primary benefit of outdoor outlets is convenience. Most homeowners find ways to connect extension cords through their homes to bring power to the outdoors. While using an extension cord is likely feasible and safe, using multiple cords in an outlet with other appliances plugged in can become dangerous. 

Instead of risking an overloaded circuit or fire hazard, you can keep your family safe by installing a GFCI outlet in your yard. The available outlet means there is no need to stretch extension cords through your property. It also means it is easier to plug-in electric tools. Outdoor outlets are safer and more convenient for outdoor activities. 

2. Entertainment

Outdoor outlets can also make summer barbeques and other outdoor events safer and more entertaining. With outdoor outlets, you can bring music, lighting, food, and drink to the party. Most outdoor plugs, when correctly installed, can power a mini-fridge, electric grill, stereo, etc., but they must be installed correctly. 

Electrical installations are not DIY projects. If you want your outlets to provide the right amount of power in a safe, efficient, and legal way, you will need the help of a licensed electrician. Licensed professionals understand the laws, and they know how electrical currents work throughout your home. By trusting the work to a pro, you help to ensure the safety and functionality of your home and property. 

3. Holidays

Thinking about the summer and later in the year, outdoor outlets can help you make the holidays more festive. Outdoor plugs will allow you to plug in various decorations and lights, making your home a pleasure to look at during the holiday season. 

The beauty of outdoor outlets is you can install more than one outlet. With various outlets installed around your property, you will never be in need of a place to plug in your decorations. Additionally, it is possible to install a secondary circuit breaker box for the outdoor outlets, allowing you complete control over your utility costs. However, to learn about the specific allowances for your property, you should contact a local electrician.

Outdoor outlets are incredibly beneficial to the typical homeowner. As a safe way to bring power to the outdoors, there is no reason to delay the installation of these extra outlets, especially with the summer finally here. Are you ready to bring some electricity outside for a bit of extra convenience? If so, contact one of the many qualified electricians with Handyman Connection and schedule an estimate. The licensed electrician will come to your property and assess your needs before making any professional recommendations.
